lasagna.name: Classic Lasagna
lasagna.description: A rich and hearty Italian classic with layers of pasta, meat sauce, and cheese.
ingredients: 4 tablespoons fresh parsley, chopped and divided
instructions: In a large pot, cook ground beef, onion, and garlic over medium heat until well browned.

Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, tomato sauce, and water. Season with sugar, Italian seasoning, basil, fennel, salt, pepper, and 2 tablespoons parsley. Simmer, covered, for about 1.5 hours, stirring occasionally.
Bring a large pot of lightly salted water to a boil. Cook lasagna noodles for 8 to 10 minutes. Drain noodles, and rinse with cold water.
In a mixing bowl, combine ricotta cheese with egg, remaining parsley, and 1/2 teaspoon salt.
Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).

To assemble, spread 1.5 cups of meat sauce in the bottom of a 9x13 inch baking dish. Arrange 6 noodles lengthwise over meat sauce. Spread with one half of the ricotta cheese mixture. Top with a third of mozzarella cheese slices. Spoon 1.5 cups meat sauce over mozzarella, and sprinkle with 1/4 cup Parmesan cheese.
Repeat layers, and top with remaining mozzarella and Parmesan cheese. Cover with foil.
Bake in preheated oven for 25 minutes. Remove foil, and bake an additional 25 minutes. Cool for 15 minutes before serving.

pizza.name: Pizza Quattro Formaggi
pizza.description: A classic Italian pizza topped with four different types of cheese for the ultimate cheese lover's experience.
instructions: Preheat your oven to 475°F (245°C). If you have a pizza stone, place it in the oven while preheating.
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface to your desired thickness.
In a small bowl, mix the olive oil and minced garlic.
Brush the garlic oil over the pizza dough, leaving a small border for the crust.
Spread the tomato sauce evenly over the dough.
Sprinkle the mozzarella cheese over the sauce.
Distribute the gorgonzola, fontina, and half of the parmesan cheese evenly over the pizza.
Transfer the pizza to a baking sheet or preheated pizza stone.
Bake for 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden and the cheese is bubbly and slightly browned.
Remove from the oven and sprinkle with the remaining parmesan cheese and fresh basil leaves.
Let cool for a few minutes before slicing and serving.

carbonara.name: Authentic Carbonara
carbonara.description: A classic Roman pasta dish made with eggs, hard cheese, cured pork, and black pepper.
ingredients: 1 cup freshly grated Pecorino Romano cheese
1 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper, plus more to taste
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the spaghetti and cook until al dente according to package instructions.
While the pasta is cooking, heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the pancetta or guanciale and sauté until crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
In a bowl, whisk together the eggs, grated Pecorino Romano cheese, and black pepper.
When the pasta is done, reserve 1/2 cup of the pasta water, then drain the pasta.
Working quickly, add the hot pasta to the skillet with the pancetta, tossing to combine.
Remove the skillet from the heat and pour in the egg and cheese mixture, stirring rapidly to create a creamy sauce. The residual heat from the pasta will cook the eggs without scrambling them.
If the sauce is too thick, add a splash of the reserved pasta water to reach your desired consistency.
Season with additional black pepper and salt if needed.
Serve immediately, garnished with extra grated cheese and black pepper.

tiramisu.name: Classic Tiramisu
tiramisu.description: A classic Italian dessert made with layers of coffee-soaked ladyfingers and mascarpone cream.
ingredients: 1/4 cup strong brewed coffee, room temperature
instructions: In a medium saucepan, whisk together egg yolks and sugar until well blended.
Whisk in milk and cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture boils. Boil gently for 1 minute, remove from heat and allow to cool slightly.
Cover tightly and chill in refrigerator for 1 hour.
In a medium bowl, beat cream with vanilla until stiff peaks form. Whisk mascarpone into yolk mixture until smooth.
In a small bowl, combine coffee and rum. Split ladyfingers in half lengthwise and drizzle with coffee mixture.
Arrange half of soaked ladyfingers in bottom of a 7x11 inch dish. Spread half of mascarpone mixture over ladyfingers, then half of whipped cream over that.
Repeat layers and sprinkle with cocoa and grated chocolate.
Cover and refrigerate for 4 to 6 hours, until set.

beefWellington.name: Beef Wellington
beefWellington.description: A classic British dish consisting of beef tenderloin wrapped in layers of pâté, duxelles, and puff pastry.
instructions: Season the beef tenderloin with salt and pepper. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over high heat and sear the beef on all sides until browned, about 2-3 minutes per side.
Remove from heat, brush with Dijon mustard, and let cool completely.
In the same skillet, melt butter and add mushrooms, shallots, and garlic. Cook until all moisture has evaporated, about 10 minutes. Stir in thyme and season with salt and pepper. Let cool completely.
Lay out a sheet of plastic wrap and arrange prosciutto slices on it, slightly overlapping, to form a rectangle large enough to wrap around the beef.

Spread the mushroom mixture (duxelles) evenly over the prosciutto, then place the cooled beef in the center. Using the plastic wrap, roll the prosciutto and duxelles around the beef, then twist the ends of the plastic to tighten. Refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
Roll out the puff pastry on a lightly floured surface to a size that will wrap around the beef. Unwrap the beef from the plastic and place in the center of the pastry.
Fold the pastry around the beef, sealing the edges with beaten egg. Trim any excess pastry and use to decorate the top if desired.
Brush the entire pastry with the egg wash (beaten egg mixed with milk).
Make a few small slits in the top of the pastry for steam to escape.
Bake for 40-45 minutes until the pastry is golden brown and the beef reaches an internal temperature of 135°F for medium-rare.
Let rest for 10 minutes before slicing and serving.
